category: Herbs that clear heat and Purge fire

action.primary: Drains Fire, relieves toxicity, eliminates Dampness, resolves lumps , relieves pain, promotes the healing of wounds and generates flesh

indications: Fire toxicity B (Chuang Yung) with sores and abscesses (can be used as a stand-alone herb)

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold.
Contraindicated for those with Yin type ulcers.
incompatibilities: Incompatible with Rx. Aconiti preparata #{ZhiChuanWu} Zhi Chuan Wu.

useCases: Sores and abscesses from Heat toxin
As an external paste for sores and abscesses from Heat toxin
Topically as a powder for ulcerated sores that do not heal
As a topical paste with vinegar for scrofula
As a topical powder for burns
Mix and apply topically for sores, carbuncles and other skin lesions. Take with Fr. Forsythiae Lian Qiao, internally.

notes: Do not store near Rx. Aconiti #{ZhiChuanWu} Wu Tou.

This herb is used for swollen sores, deep-set noxious sores, scrofula, warm malarial disorders, Intestinal Wind, bleeding hemorrhoids, redness in the eyes, children's fright seizures and painful swelling in the vagina.
It activates the sinews to promote Blood circulation.
Apply topically as a single herb for burns.
This herb has been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells.
It is said to relieve pain in the waist, feet, arms and legs through washing with its decoction.
The juice can promote urination, activate the Small Intestine and reduce swelling when taken orally.
Vomiting can be stopped by sipping the strong juice.
For hot water burns, make a paste and apply to the burned area. It leaves fewer scars.

Both Bai Lian and Hb. Taraxaci #{PuGongYing} Pu Gong Ying clear Heat, resolve toxicity, disperse clumps and reduce abscesses and sores. They are frequently used together. Bai Lian is stronger at both dispersing clumps and generating flesh and is especially useful when sores come to a head but refuse to open or when the ulcerations fail to heal. Pu Gong Ying is used for any Yang type sores that are red, swollen, hot and painful, especially those that affect the breasts.
